strCategoryDescription: Beef is the culinary name for meat from cattle, particularly skeletal muscle. Humans have been eating beef since prehistoric times.
Chicken is a type of domesticated fowl, a subspecies of the red junglefowl. It is one of the most common and widespread domestic animals.
Dessert is a course that concludes a meal. The course usually consists of sweet foods, such as confections dishes or fruit.
Pasta is a staple food of traditional Italian cuisine, with the first reference dating to 1154 in Sicily.
Seafood is any form of sea life regarded as food by humans. Seafood prominently includes fish and shellfish.
Vegetarian cuisine is based on food that meets vegetarian standards by not including meat and animal tissue products.
Breakfast is the first meal of a day. The word derives from breaking the fasting period of the previous night.
Lamb, hogget, and mutton are the meat of domestic sheep at different ages.
